title: Louisville campus police reviewing escort allegations
text:
Updated: 3:28 p.m. Tuesday, Oct. 6, 2015 | Posted: 3:27 p.m. Tuesday, Oct. 6, 2015 Louisville campus police reviewing escort allegations Related Louisville head coach Rick Pitino responds to a question following an NCAA college basketball team's intrasquad scrimmage Saturday, Oct. 3, 2015, in Louisville, Ky. (AP Photo/Timothy D. Easley) Sponsored Links By GARY B. GRAVES The Associated Press 
Louisville campus police say they are reviewing allegations that a former men's basketball staffer hired escorts to dance and have sex with recruits and players in a dormitory. 
Katina Powell has alleged in a book released online over the weekend that former Cardinals director of basketball operation Andre McGee paid her $10,000 for dancers to perform 22 shows from 2010-14 at the players' Billy Minardi Hall dormitory. The school reported those allegations to the NCAA and has launched an investigation. 
University police chief Wayne Hall said Tuesday in a brief statement his department is also working with Louisville Metro Police and the Commonwealth Attorney's Office to review Powell's allegations against the program. 
Cardinals coach Rick Pitino has said that McGee denied Powell's allegations. 
McGee is currently an assistant at Missouri-Kansas City, which has put him on paid leave. Copyright The Associated Press Sign up for our WFTV Morning News Headlines Newsletter Sign Up
